modules.description: Provides functions to extract and manipulate repository links from Opam repository configurations. Works with OpamTypes.repository and OpamFile.Repo.t data structures. Used to generate dependency graphs and validate remote repository sources.

Handles package repository mappings, predicate satisfaction checks, and URL generation for package references. Operates on OpamPackage, OpamFile.OPAM, and OpamTypes structures. Used to determine if package constraints are met, generate package links, and retrieve metadata from repositories.

Provides functions for parsing and manipulating OPAM package constraints, including version ranges and dependency specifications. Works with strings, lists, and custom types representing package names and version intervals. Used to validate package versions and resolve dependency conflicts during build processes.

Provides predicate evaluation, index retrieval, and repository listing operations. Works with lists of predicates, index data, and repository structures. Used to filter package sets, fetch package metadata, and manage repository configurations.

Extracts and manipulates repository links from Opam configurations, working with repository and OPAM file structures to build dependency graphs and validate sources. Evaluates package constraints, generates references, and retrieves metadata using package and predicate-based logic. Supports operations like link generation, constraint checking, and repository mapping. Can determine if a package meets version requirements, construct URLs for package versions, and verify repository consistency.

This module handles logical operations on version constraints, focusing on evaluating, simplifying, and transforming expressions into normal forms like DNF to manage package dependencies. It works with structured data such as expression trees, version sets, and package-version pairs to model and enforce compatibility conditions. Key use cases include resolving dependency conflicts and ensuring correct version selection in OPAM workflows.
